column5: Ouch, Billy Bob.........you may not get across the border on your next attempt with this one lol
And I noticed NOT 1 other post about yesterday's game...but it's still early....maybe Canada is in mourning.

I'm not sure why anybody underestimated the USA team. Many of them are young and just barely spoiled millionaires. Burke did the right thing by going with a young team. I dont think nidermire or pronger should have been on the team,and id make 2 or 3 adjustments with the forwards as well.  there have been a few upsets so far so to be honest i have no idea how this will shake out. i do believe usa,canada and russia will get medals, just not sure what colour they will be.
Here too.....  .....might as well get rid of the computer.....
thats a good ol fashioned Zinger right there!  He truly was on last night!  What a perfomance he put on for the world to see.

definitely a helluva performance, and the kind of goaltending that could take them to the finals. that said, if brodeur even had a pulse and a few neurons firing last night, millers performance may not have won the game for them.  just goes to show how important goaltending is.

Either Canada or Russia will be out of the medals, as they will meet each other in the quarters on wednesday afternoon.  Hopefully one day soon, we will play a game where we don't run into a super hot goalie.
This happened in the juniours....only it was the other way around. Be careful with pokes unless you enjoy crow.

I went to the last Buffalo/Washington game and saw Miller post a 3-0 shut out of Ovechkin & all. It was stunning to see live. They threw everything but the kitchen sink at him and he was amazing. Yesterdays performance was no surprise to anyone that has watched him play (keep in mind Billy B that he does not make it to TV here very often). Jim
Oh, OK... I would think since we are right on the border you would get a lot of Sabres game up there.  GOOD LUCK TEAM CANADA today.  Bob
